page.title: 02GEOGRAPHY & ECOLOGY.
page.content: GEOGRAPHY & THE NATURAL HISTORY.The soils around Erbistock are mainly heavy clay soils.Nearer Ruabon they are medium loam and nearer the Wynnstay Park they are sandy or light loam.The wild life includes rabbits,hares,hedgehogs,badgers, polecats and wild ferrets.Occasionally a small herd of deer,driven out of the Wynnstay Park during the last war,move from Erbistock to the Park Eyton Wood. Foxes abound as this is the area of the Wynnstay Hunt.Bird life includes crows ,rooks,blackbirds,magpies, woodpeckers,herons(Park Eyton area) and pheasants as there is an organised shoot.There are ponds and water wild life such as cootes,moorhens and snipe and coarse fish such as perch, tench, roach, dace and rudd.
